why: Better sleep reduces pain sensitivity and speeds tissue repair.

slides.title: Sleep & Healing
slides.content: Quality sleep is when your body does most of its tissue repair and recovery work

slides.title: 7-9 Hours Target
slides.content: Most adults need 7-9 hours of quality sleep for optimal recovery and pain management

slides.title: Sleep Hygiene Basics
slides.content: Consistent schedule, cool dark room, no screens before bed, and limiting caffeine after 2pm

slides.title: Sleep Architecture
slides.content: Deep sleep and REM cycles are crucial for tissue repair and memory consolidation during recovery.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: You can catch up on weekends. Fact: Irregular patterns still impair recovery.
